name: Baked Honey Sriracha Salmon
author: Nichole
summary: Sweet and spicy, honey sriracha salmon baked in foil is tender and flaky and has the most incredible flavors. A nutritious and easy 30-minute meal for salmon lovers!
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with foil, grease lightly, and lay salmon on top
Season salmon with salt and pepper
Slide lime slices under the edges of the salmon
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat
Stir in honey, sriracha sauce, lime juice, soy sauce, and garlic
Reduce heat to medium and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more
Pour 2/3 of the sauce over the salmon
Use a spoon or spatula to make sure the sauce covers the salmon, leaving no dry spots
Fold up edges of the foil around the salmon to keep the sauce from spilling out
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
Broil until the edges of the salmon start to char slightly, 4 to 5 minutes
Watch carefully so the salmon doesn't burn
Top salmon with remaining sauce and garnish with cilantro
